events.name: Coffee&Code
events.description: Coffee&Code¬†format is a meetup for Android developers. It's a healthy mix of experienced developers and beginners. We come together to exchange knowledge, discuss new techniques and OS features, or simply work on our own apps and projects.

events.name: Android Developer Meetup
events.description:
If you care about runtime permissions, if you want to find out what's new in Android O, but were afraid to ask, now is the right time to come to listen and to ask by yourself.

This time the guys will tell what adventures await the Android developer who at some point decided to implement the runtime permissions into his application. But the code base of the application is already rather big. Also find out what awaits us if we want to adapt our application to a new version of SDK. All this and not only can be discovered and asked personally. We are waiting for everyone at our meetup.

The event is free but please go and register on the following link -¬†https://goo.gl/bwekgA

Agenda:

üí• Adventures to the runtime permissions world, Anton Novikov, Lead Android Developer at Viber Media¬†

Will tell about the implementation of runtime permissions in Viber App

üí• What's new in Android O, Sergey Popkov, Senior Android Developer at ScienseSoft

A story about what the new Google has prepared for developers in the new version of Android SDK.

The partner of the community is the company Social Discovery Ventures

events.name: Android Developer Meetup
events.description:
Meetup dedicated to the issues of Android-development will be held in the Minsk office of Gismart.

Topics:

1. Remote Config or how to please everyone.Let's talk about creating your own remote application configuration solution, providing A/B testing and how we put Reflection and RxJava on the service of good.

2. Our way of providing data for analytical systems.We'll tell you about our own decision to collect, store and submit parameters for analytics events and talk about how not to overload the application with analytics.

3. Kotlin: home fun! (guest report from Pavel Shchegelsky, Android developer in Ciklum)

In addition to the reports, there will be food, drinks, lots of communication and music. Other useful information you can find on facebook¬†https://www.facebook.com/events/1960983200780732/

The event is free, the number of seats is strictly limited. Registration under the link: https://goo.gl/forms/RcqagF7pRlsUcU3u2

Subscribe and follow the life of Gismart here: https://www.instagram.com/gismartmusic/

events.name: Android Developer Meetup
events.description:
We are waiting for everyone who is interested in Google technologies and API, as well as those who are already successfully implementing them in their projects.

Admission is free by prior registration - https://goo.gl/CjcXnq

Agenda:

üí• ¬†Unit-Testing of presentation layer, Vladimir Khudnitsky, Mobile Lead at Springworks AB

Vladimir will show how to build an architecture that will allow you to test the behaviour of fragments/activities using unit tests and do it quickly without waisting time

üí• ¬†Firebase: to use or not to use?, Andrei Mykamolov, ASW Systems a.s., Developer

If you want to integrate Firebase into your current project or want to start a new application based on Firebase, then you will probably be interested to know how it will behave in production and how much effort is needed for integration. The presentation will describe the most high-tech technologies provided by Firebase - Realtime Database and Cloud Functions, the cost of implementation and crutches that are born during integration, as well as several useful libraries and a real example.

The partner of the community is the company¬†Social Discovery Ventures

events.name: Android Developer Meetup
events.description:
‚Ä¢ What we'll do
On January 23, SPACE will host the GDG Minsk Meetup.

Participation is free of charge. You must fill out the registration form: https://goo.gl/GdD3he

Meetup agenda:

18:30 Register

19:00 Cyril Rozov, Android Developer, Apalon Apps
Constraint Layout. Feel the power of constraints
When I saw ConstrainLayout, I saw a wild unbridled power, but apart from it ... something truly priceless ... the new look at the creation.
Learn to control the Power of ConstraintLayout and you can create UI in Android faster and more convenient.

20:00 Cyril Shashkov, iOS Developer, Toptal (freelance)
The application of ARCore + Unity in practice
How ARCore works, the difference from Apple's ARKit. Creation of augmented reality with reference to the real world.

21:00 Networking

Partners mitapa companies Apalon and Social Discovery Ventures.

‚Ä¢ What to bring

‚Ä¢ Important to know

events.name: Android Developer Meetup
events.description:
Participation is free of charge for registration >> https://goo.gl/forms/chbjoPrWkCQhdGeC3

üìå Agenda:

‚ñ™Ô∏è How to code to code less, Anton Novikov, Lead Android Developer, Viber Media
Anton will tell you how to avoid boilerplate code with Annotation Processors and make fewer mistakes. Those who listen carefully will learn how to use their two plastic bottles and blue tape to make their Room or another library with code generation ... or at least understand how such libraries work.

‚ñ™Ô∏è General cleaning in APK, Kirill Rozov, Android developer, Apalon Apps
Did you know that in most of the world, downloading a small application can result in 5-10 minutes of waiting? And what about the fact that there is a direct relationship between the size of APK and the number of downloads? There is an exit! And you can learn about it from the report.

Date: March 27th.
Registration starts at 18.30, the beginning of the reports is 19.00.

events.name: Android Academy Minsk # 1: Introduction
events.description:
July 9 in Minsk starts Android-Academy - classes once a week, where you will get basic knowledge about Android-development:

üìåPrinciples of Activity and Fragment
üìåFeatures of constructing UI
üìåWorking with multithreading
üìåCharging network requests
üìåStorage of data on the device

By the end of the course, under the guidance of our lecturers and mentors, you will be able to create a full-fledged application!

Learn more about the course and register here >> https://eventspace-by.timepad.ru/event/743557/

events.name: GDG Minsk July Meetup
events.description:
July 25 on the SPACE EventSpace.BY will be the next meetup of the GDG Minsk community!

Only registration is required for participation >> https://eventspace-by.timepad.ru/event/765671/

Agenda:

üìåDelivery mindset, Ivan Trifonov, SA / DM, Facemetrics

üìå Launch of a neural network on Android, Natalia Kukharchik, Android developer / Data Scientist, FLO

Partner of the event is Flo: Technology. Thanks to the company's support, we can develop and delight you with treats, videos and souvenirs.

Registration of participants starts from 18.30, the beginning at 19.00.

events.name: Viber Android Meetup
events.description:
27th of July GDG Minsk together with Viber Media organize an Android Meetup in a new cosy Viber office.

Registration is required for participation: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSe1nD0oYwQ_wu_xTLGQ0gJaCN8YfyI2R_L6gvRmnep1cYFbTg/viewform

As a confirmation we'll send you all the guides on how to get to the venue.

Agenda:

üìå Yonatan V. Levin
Google Developers Expert, Co-founder and CTO @ KolGene, Israel

¬´WTF with Android Background Restrictions¬ª

With recent Android releases, the wild west of endless running threads is over.
No more smoking barrels of "last 5% battery".
You are required to act and seriously consider how you became the excellent citizen of Android device and play side by side with a marshal law of background tasks. Or die trying.
It's a talk we will explore how memory affect a background process, what solutions we have today and how new WorkManager can save our lives and galaxy :)

üìå Yegor Malyshev, Senior Android Developer @ Viber Media.

¬´A mysterious journey to MVP world¬ª

A story full of pain and tears telling how to implement MVP for the big project with lots of legacy code and not die.

Registration: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSe1nD0oYwQ_wu_xTLGQ0gJaCN8YfyI2R_L6gvRmnep1cYFbTg/viewform

Registration of participants starts at 18.00, the beginning is at 19.00.
Venue: office of Viber Media (Nemiga street, 5).

Go

events.name: Special Android Academy Event
events.description:
Wooahaa!!

The Android Fundamentals is over! But we just started!
We are working very hard to organize an Advanced course. Meanwhile, we're very thrilled and happy to announce new meetup with 3 ‚ùóspeakers:

üìå "Android X 101" by Pavel Bogretsov, Wimix LLC

One of the biggest Android news at I/O this year was AndroidX which represents a new era for the Support Library. Pavel will dive in to show how we can migrate our projects to support this new approach. Want to know more what was exciting about this new update then come and check it.

üìå "Developing Software as a Self-employed in Belarus" by Vlad Zamskoi, Freelancer

Vlad will describe his fascinating story about the formation, design and working conditions of a freelancer. Many of us considered to be a freelancer but usually, lots of questions "how to" are raised which stops us from continuing. With Vlad, we are going to shed light on this problem and find out how he managed to resolve the issues along the way.

üìå "Fun Android Topic by our loved Yonatan Levin" by Yonatan Levin, Google Developer Expert

You know it's doesn't matter what exactly he is going to talk - it's going to be interesting :)

See you on time, we start sharp on time - 17 November, 16:00

The partner of the meetup is the company Flo: Technology. Flo is the world's fastest-growing health platform focused on women's health.

Thanks to the support of the company, we can develop and delight you with video recordings of reports, branded souvenirs.

events.name: GDG DevFest Belarus 2018
events.description:
GDG DevFest Belarus 2018 will be held on 16 of December at SPACE. The event is organized by GDG Minsk with the support of SPACE Hub (SPACE EventSpace.BY).

GDG DevFest Belarus is a community conference dedicated to web & mobile trends, as well as some other trending IT technologies.

And confirmed speakers and talks are:

events.description:
Registration is required >> https://www.eventbrite.com/e/post-google-io-or-whats-new-in-android-tickets-64987911593

Boy oh boy! Here we go again! 2019 Google I\O is over and we gathered all the interesting bits and pieces that you absolutely can‚Äôt miss.

Pavel Bogretsov, Pavel Sliusar, Vasya Drobushkov, Pavel Shchahelski and Yonatan Levin are going to tell you about the changes that are both annoying or exciting, and share the future of Android development as presented by Google this year. Some of the things we are going to talk about are:

üìå In-App Updates

üìå Scoped Storage

üìå Dark Mode

üìå Jetpack Compose

üìå CameraX

üìå MotionLayout

And much much more!

Join us on the 19th of July, at Space!

The partner of the meetup is the company Fitbit. Thanks to the support of the company, we can develop and delight you with video recordings of reports, branded souvenirs.

events.name: Android Academy Minsk: Working from the background
events.description:
‚ö°Ô∏èEvery Android app has a main thread which is in charge of handling UI (including measuring and drawing views), coordinating user interactions, and receiving lifecycle events. If there is too much work happening on this thread, the app appears to hang or slow down, leading to an undesirable user experience.

Any long-running computations and operations such as decoding a bitmap, accessing the disk, or performing network requests should be done on a separate background thread. In general, anything that takes more than a few milliseconds should be delegated to a background thread.

Together with you, we will find out all the answers to these topics.

üìå Services - deep dive
üìå IntentService
üìå Scheduling operations
üìå Background limitations since Android Oreo

üïñFull agenda & registration https://www.eventbrite.com/e/android-fundamentals-10-working-from-the-background-tickets-79859298311

Great thanks to our partners Fitbit & EPAM.

events.name: Android Academy Minsk: Notifications and Broadcasts
events.description:
‚úÖ Notifications provide short, timely information about events in your app while it's not in use. A notification in its most basic and compact form (also known as collapsed form) displays an icon, a title, and a small amount of content text.

Together with you, we will learn how to create and manage Notifications.

We will also consider Broadcasts.

Android apps can send or receive broadcast messages from the Android system and other Android apps, similar to the publish-subscribe design pattern. These broadcasts are sent when an event of interest occurs.

üìå Introduction to Notifications
üìå Introduction to BroadcastReceivers
üìå ContentProvider

üïñFull agenda & registration https://www.eventbrite.com/e/android-fundamentals-11-notifications-and-broadcasts-tickets-81212321239

Great thanks to our partners Fitbit & EPAM.

events.name: WTM Minsk Autumn Breakfast 2019: IT Moms
events.description:
I‚Äôm excited to launch a series of WTM Minsk breakfasts that will be dedicated to different tech & non-tech topics to make our community adaptive and prominent among tech women and those starting in IT.

The November WTM Minsk breakfast I want to dedicate to working IT moms and those who paused the tech career to raise children but didn‚Äôt give up to develop skills, mentoring or even merged work into this period.

Event format: Panel discussion with several IT moms and their experience & questions from attendees.

Important: You are encouraged to bring children with you. I will! There is a special children‚Äôs zone to play, menu and mom‚Äôs room.

events.description:

‚ö°Ô∏èHead of Yandex system development team Maxim Samoilov will talk about the company's in-house infrastructure solution designed to search for complex, massive network failures, as well as an approach to measuring network performance. The speaker will highlight the main challenges that may be encountered in building this distributed monitoring system.

‚ö°Ô∏èDmitry Lipin, Head of Head of basic infrastructure services at Yandex , will talk about a system whose tasks include providing computing power, that is, servers, to other Yandex services. Particular attention will be paid to the safety of such a system.

‚ö°Ô∏èThe third speaker, Dmitry Yatskevich, Director of Engineering at Flo, will talk about the company's experience with using EKS, about the basic principles and stages of migration. Dmitry will explain what you need to pay attention to, what results in accelerating the processes we received and how the services behave at high loads.

events.name: WTM: Online Speedrun Challenge: BigQuery, Kubernetes, etc.
events.description:
Hello!

Recently you‚Äôve might participated in the Google Cloud Study Jam organized by the Women Techmakers Minsk community assisted by the EPAM Systems experts in GCP.
That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre excited to participate in the first Community Speedrun Challenge that Google is organizing for developer communities in Europe. And as part of the WTM Minsk, you‚Äôre among the first to know about this!!

The Community Speedrun Challenge is a training program that will run in February where you‚Äôll have the opportunity to join four Speedruns and get hands-on experience with tools like Kubernetes, Assistant, BigQuery our Cloud Run, Every Speedrun is open for a week to give you the ability to finish all labs in your best time, scoring more points and winning prizes.

Find more information and register here: bit.ly/speedrunchallenge0220

Schedule:
Speedrun Start Dates: February 3, 10, 17 and 24.
Webinar Time: Monday from 7pm to 9pm (GMT+1)/ 9pm to 23pm (Minsk time)

For more details please follow our WTM Minsk FB page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1136914882993034/?ref=share

events.name: [Android Advanced] Topic #0 - Coroutines
events.description:
üìÇA coroutine is a concurrency design pattern that you can use on Android to simplify code that executes asynchronously. Coroutines were added to Kotlin in version 1.3 and are based on established concepts from other languages.
On Android, coroutines help to solve two primary problems:
Manage long-running tasks that might otherwise block the main thread and cause your app to freeze.
Providing main-safety, or safely calling network or disk operations from the main thread.
Special guest Yonatan Levin will tell all the details of a ViewModel and what lies under the hood of these technologies.

Together with you, we will know:
üëâBasics
üëâChannels
üëâStructured Concurrency
üëâCoroutine Context and Dispatchers
üëâShared Mutable State and Concurrency
üëâAsynchronous Flow

‚û°Ô∏è Registration - https://www.eventbrite.com/e/android-advanced-topic-0-coroutines-tickets-89474750387

Great thanks to our partners Fitbit & EPAM.

See you soon!
Android Academy team.

events.name: GDG & WTM Minsk Mobile Meetup
events.description:
On February 7, SPACE will host the GDG & WTM Minsk Mobile Meetup from the GDG Minsk and WTM Minsk communities.

üìåIn a programme:

‚ö°Ô∏è Ekaterina Sheremet, Google Developer Expert in Flutter and Dart, WTM leader in Switzerland, freelancer, develops her own projects and applications, speaks at conferences and writes articles about Flutter and Dart.

Flutter for Android Developers

Flutter is a fast-growing cross-platform development framework. But if you have Android knowledge or even a finished application, do you need to learn and rewrite everything from scratch? This report is about how to apply existing knowledge and experience in Android to develop applications in Flutter. We will also learn how to add Flutter to an existing Android project.

‚ö°Andrey Lesnitsky, Self-employed, helps companies jump on Flutter-train

Let‚Äôs build a chat with Flutter in N minutes

Livecoding with Flutter and firebase. Andrey will demonstrate the simplicity of implementation a chat application with basic functionality, consider typical approaches to building a layout and an interesting approach to state management in a Flutter application.

üïñParticipants gathering - at 18.30, the start - at 19.00.

Pre-registration is available here - https://gdg-minsk.timepad.ru/event/1235545/
Participation is free.

events.name: [Android Advanced] Topic #1 - Workshop Coroutines
events.description:
Required knowledge: View Model, LiveData, Retrofit
We've prepared for you interesting and challenging task: the "Fast Finger" game. During the workshop we will go together thought the prepared project and implement the game step by step. Apart from game-play we'll work with network and database, that's why knowledge of Retrofit and Room is required. In-game chat will be the final task.
During the implementation you'll get real experience of: suspend functions, coroutines scopes, Room and Retrofit, Flows, Channels.
We expect troubles with internet connection, so you have to setup project in advance! See instructions in the project repository.

During the workshop students complete 3 tasks:

1.‚ÄúFast finger‚Äù game

Task covers:
a)suspend functions
b)delay
c)view model scope

2.Network + Storage
Task covers:
a)Retrofit integration
b)Room integration

3.Super Simple Chat
Task covers:
a)Flow basics
b)Channels
c)BTW, we create a telegram chat for the discussions!

See you soon!
Android Academy team.

Great thanks to our partners Fitbit & EPAM!

events.name: GDG Mobile Meetup
events.description:
On February 19, SPACE will host the GDG Mobile Meetup.

Program:

Yuri Bychik, Android Engineer, Readdle

Spark Mail for Android: how to use cross-platform Swift in a large project

‚ÄúWhen there is a ready-made application for iOS, then there is a natural desire to use the written code for Android. The task itself is not easy, but it has a curious solution.
I‚Äôll tell you how we experimented with the release of Spark Mail and released an Android app with probably the largest Swift kernel in the world. "

Andrey Mankevich

SafetyNet on Android

"SafetyNet application security system was added in Android 7.0 Nougat. Let's try to see how SafetyNet is built from the inside and what the secret DroidGuard virtual machine does. I‚Äôll tell you how I hacked Android protection, what easter eggs Google leaves for hackers inside its security system and and how I didn't get a job at Google.. "

üïñParticipants gathering - at 18.30, the start - at 19.00.

Pre-registration is available here - https://gdg-minsk.timepad.ru/event/1256782/
Participation is free.

upcoming.name: [Android Advanced] Topic #2 - Architecture
upcoming.description:
A good software architecture allows the system to be easy to understand, to develop, to maintain and to implement.
The most important principle to follow is separation of concerns. It's a common mistake to write all your code in an Activity or a Fragment. These UI-based classes should only contain logic that handles UI and operating system interactions. By keeping these classes as lean as possible, you can avoid many lifecycle-related problems.

Together with you at a lecture, we will consider:

1) Introduction to Architecture as meaning
2) Main principles
3) Clean Architecture overview

BTW, we create a telegram chat for the discussions!

‚û°Ô∏è Registration - https://www.eventbrite.com/e/android-advanced-topic-2-architecture-tickets-94966947697

See you soon!

Android Academy team.
